map_generator package¶

Submodules¶

map_generator.generate_map module¶

class map_generator.generate_map.GenerateMap[source]¶

Bases: object

This class is responsible for generating the map of city in which source and destination lies. It also saves the generated map into the cache in case of cache miss and serves the map from cache in case of case hit

add_node_elevations_open(G, max_locations_per_batch=180, pause_duration=0.02, precision=3)[source]¶

Osmnx provides method get_node_elevation_google which attaches elevation data to each node of the generated graph using Google’s elevation API. Although Google’s elevation API is not free, hence here we have modified this function to use open-elevation API which is an open source version of Google’s elevation API.

generateGraphPlot(graph)[source]¶

This function plots the map using osmnx default graph plotter and saves it as a jpg image

Args:

graph (osmnx.graph): The map to be plotted

generateMap(city, state)[source]¶

This method generates map of the city and state with elevation info attached to each node For getting the elevation info we are using open elevation API which is free version of Google’s elevation API For generating the map we wil be using osmnx map generator.

Args:

city(str): City state(str): State

getLocationInfo(location: str)[source]¶
This method fetches city, state and lat-long info for a particular address. City and state is fetched by parsing the address data

while latitude and longitude is fetched using geopy library.

Args:

location (str): Address for which location data needs to be fetched

Return:
dict: A dictionary consisting {“lat”:<latitude <str>>,

“long”:<longitude <str>>, “city”:<str>, “state”:<str>}
